summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from December 2019 discussing attorney David Schoen's role on Jeffrey Epstein's defense team. The emails express disbelief and criticism regarding Schoen's involvement and his public statements about Epstein.

persons.name: David Schoen
persons.context: Described as the "quarterback" of Jeffrey Epstein's defense team. An interview he gave is discussed, with the sender expressing disbelief in his statements.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant whose case is the subject of the email discussion. The emails reference his death and his consultation with David Schoen.

connections.description: Schoen was a defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, consulted by him days before his death.

events.title: NYT Article on Epstein's Death
events.description: A New York Times article about Epstein's suicide death is referenced and linked in an email.

events.title: Schoen Interview Published
events.description: An interview with David Schoen about consulting for Jeffrey Epstein is published, described as "huge, crazy, absurdly self-aggrandizing."

keyFacts: Attorney David Schoen was a key member of Jeffrey Epstein's defense team, described as its "quarterback."
Schoen gave a major interview about his consultation with Epstein shortly before Epstein's death, which the email authors found unbelievable and self-aggrandizing.
The email chain expresses shock and criticism at the idea of Schoen leading Epstein's defense.
